This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
@Alex-302 

No issues with google / cloudflare DNS **disabled** (as expected, no DNS is active)

However, messages still fail to send with either google or cloudflare DNS enabled (with all custom filters disabled, nothing is blocked)

Furthermore, this behavior only starts happening the *second* time tiktok is opened with a DNS connected.
Steps to reproduce:
1. DNS is connected
2. Tiktok is opened and a message is sent **successfully**
3. Tiktok is closed and re-opened
4. A message is sent **unsuccessfully** and not received by anyone
5. This behavior proceeds to occur until the DNS is disabled

So, as this only starts happening the second time the app is opened, this seems to be a software-based limitation on tiktoks end, right?
There is no reason why it should only work the first time, unless tiktok give you that one time as leeway to turn off your DNS/VPN again.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
